document.masterDocTitle: First description of the female of Lysiteles minimus (Araneae: Thomisidae) from Liupan Mountains, Ningxia, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First description of the female of Lysiteles minimus (Araneae: Thomisidae) from Liupan Mountains, Ningxia, China

Xysticus minimus
Schenkel, 1953
: 55
, figs 27 a–b. [ Holotype : male, from southeastern Gansu, presumably lost, not examined]
Lysiteles minimus (Schenkel)
.

Diagnosis. Among the congeners, the new species is very similar to
L. niger
Ono, 1979
in similar body coloration, as well as in male and female genitalia, but it differs from the latter by: embolus thick and strong (
Figs 6–7
; pointed and thinner in
L. niger
); retrolateral tibial apophysis wide, tip biforked, dorsal branch with two denticulations (
Fig. 7
; tip not biforked in
L. niger
); the distance of two COs about half of the width of the TSP (
Figs 3–4
; the distance of the COs is almost same width of the TSP in
L. niger
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–2.
Lysiteles minimus (Schenkel, 1953)
. 1 Male body, dorsal view; 2 Female body, dorsal view. Scale bars: 0.5 mm.

FIGURES 3–7.
Lysiteles minimus (Schenkel, 1953)
. 3 Epigynum , ventral view; 4 Vulva, dorsal view; 5–7. Left male palp (5 prolateral, 6 ventral, 7 retrolateral). Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Epigynum
(
Figs 3–4
). TSP wide; copulatory openings centrally; copulatory ducts thick and short; spermathecae spherical.
